intro: Cladomyza angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed cladomyza, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
